snippet: In Alabama, a bizarre arrangement allows elected judges to override a jury verdict of life in prison and unilaterally impose a death sentence.
abstract: Editorial laments Supreme Court decision that leaves in place unique provision allowing judges in Alabama to override jury verdicts in order to impose death sentences; agrees with dissenting Justice Sonia Sotomayor who argued that elected judges are prone to mete out capital punishment for political reasons.
lead_paragraph: In Alabama, a bizarre arrangement allows elected judges to override a jury verdict of life in prison and unilaterally impose a death sentence.

headline.main: Death Meted Out by Politicians in Robes
headline.print_headline: Death Meted Out by Politicians in Robes
